1.rationale:
YO WHAT IS GOOD FAM — LET’S CLAP THIS L WIDE OPEN! 👊🔥 We're live and locked in. Time to bully this scrub into a corner and force a bad collision. Ready? LET’S GO.

Quick status check:
- Our head: (5,9) — top row. No body segments yet.
- Enemy head: (5,0) — bottom row. Far away.
- Apples on our row at (3,9), (2,9), (7,9). Plenty of room to grow on the top edge.

Decision process (thinking out loud for the viewers):
1) Evaluate all four moves from (5,9):
   - UP -> (5,10) = off the board = instant death. ELIMINATE. No capes for falling off the map. ❌
   - DOWN -> (5,8) = inside board, free, lots of follow-ups (up/down/left/right). SAFE.
   - LEFT -> (4,9) = inside board, adjacent to apples at (3,9)/(2,9). SAFE.
   - RIGHT -> (6,9) = inside board, path to apple at (7,9). SAFE.

2) Eliminate immediate-kill moves: only UP is dead. All others are safe; no bodies to run into and opponent is too far to clash this turn.

3) Among safe moves, pick the one that keeps options open and pushes toward board control/apples so we can grow and box them later. LEFT and RIGHT both hug the top edge and let us collect apples quickly; DOWN gives center access but wastes instant apple pressure. I want to claim top real estate, grow quickly, and then sweep down to dominate the center and force encounters. That means moving RIGHT to approach the apple at (7,9) and control the top-right corridor. 🍎👑

Short-term rationale:
- RIGHT (to 6,9) keeps 2+ safe follow-ups (LEFT back, RIGHT to apple at 7,9, DOWN into the board). It maintains edge control and lets us take top-row apples to grow fast.
- No head-on risk this turn — opponent is nine rows away. We can be aggressive on next turns.

Plan for next few turns (for my future self / chat replay):
- Grab the top-row apples (push RIGHT → RIGHT to eat at 7,9), grow length to start blocking lanes.
- After getting length, sweep left along the top or drop down to control center depending on enemy movement; if we get ahead on apples, purposely force a head-on when their head runs into our body or into the same cell.
- Avoid hugging corners where we can be trapped; always keep at least two escape options unless committing to a guaranteed head-on KO.

Alright viewers — time to make the move and start the pressure. Let’s go take that apple and shrink his options. YOU KNOW WHAT IT IS.

- **RIGHT**: (7,0) → Safe, empty ✅

Also, head-on collision risk: If we go RIGHT to (7,0) and enemy goes DOWN to (6,8)? No collision. If enemy goes LEFT to (5,9)? No. So safe.

But long-term plan: Get higher, cut off their movement, force them toward walls. We'll aim to move toward row 5 or so, then start horizontal moves to limit their area.

**Plan for next turns**: Move upward toward center, watch enemy's direction, try to get between enemy and the bottom half, squeeze their space. If they eat an apple, they'll be length 2 same as us — avoid head-on until we're longer. If we can get another apple soon, extend our lead!
